intro: Chytraculia concinna, commonly known as the slender chytraculid, is a species of aquatic fungus belonging to the order Chytridiales. It is characterized by its small, motile zoospores that are typically 10–15 micrometers in length. This fungus is often found in freshwater environments, particularly in stagnant or slow-moving waters. Its life cycle involves both asexual and sexual reproduction, with the formation of sporangia that release the zoospores into the water. Chytraculia concinna plays a role in the decomposition of organic matter in aquatic ecosystems.
